Package Model

Class EngineCommand

java.lang.Object
Model.EngineCommand
public class EngineCommand extends Object
This class contains implementation of all the actions defined by the game

  • Method Details

    • editMap

      public WargameMap editMap(String p_mapName)
      This method would check if the map with given Name exists If it does it would load that map and would check with player if they want to edit the map Otherwise it would create new WargameMap object and would prompt user for next commands
      Parameters:
      p_mapName - name of the given map
      Returns:
      existing or new WargameMap object

    • addContinentToMap

      public boolean addContinentToMap(WargameMap p_gameMap, int p_continentControlValue, String p_continentName)

    • removeContinentFromMap

      public boolean removeContinentFromMap(WargameMap p_gameMap, String p_continentName)
      This will remove continent from the map. In order to do that we first have to remove each country resides in that continent, and then we can remove the continent itself.
      Parameters:
      p_gameMap -
      p_continentName -
      Returns:
      returns true if continent is successfully remove otherwise false

    • addCountryToContinent

      public boolean addCountryToContinent(WargameMap p_gameMap, String p_userGivenCountryName, String p_userGivenContinentName)
      This function add the given country into the given continent.
      Parameters:
      p_gameMap - Game map object
      p_userGivenCountryName - country name that we are adding to the continent
      p_userGivenContinentName - continent name that we are adding into
      Returns:
      true if country is added successfully to the continent otherwise false

    • removeCountry

      public boolean removeCountry(WargameMap p_gameMap, String p_countryNameToBeRemoved)
      This methods removes the country from map.

      To remove country, first check that country exists in map if yes then get all the neighbouring countries of the country that we want to remove. Then iterate over those neighbouring countries and remove this given country from their list of neighbouring countries. Then remove the country itself from the continent and map.

      Parameters:
      p_gameMap - map object
      p_countryNameToBeRemoved - country to be removed
      Returns:
      true if country is removed else false

    • addNeighbour

      public boolean addNeighbour(WargameMap p_map, String p_countryName, String p_neighborCountryName)
      Parameters:
      p_map - Game map object
      p_countryName - name of the country to be added
      p_neighborCountryName - name of the neighbouring country to be added
      Returns:
      returns true if neighbour is successfully added otherwise false

    • removeNeighbour

      public boolean removeNeighbour(WargameMap p_gameMap, String p_neighbourCountryName, String p_toBeRemovedCountryName)
      Parameters:
      p_gameMap - Game map object
      p_neighbourCountryName - the name of the neighbour country of the country which we are removing
      p_toBeRemovedCountryName - the name of the actual country name that we are removing.
      Returns:
      true if neighbour removal operation is successful otherwise false

    • checkGameMap

      public boolean checkGameMap(WargameMap p_gameMap)
      This function checks whether the game map is valid or not. Here first checking for the empty continents in the map if they do not exist then checking for each continent's subgraph if each continent's subgraph is also connected then checking for the entire game map if it is also connected then simple returning true if any of the above stages returns false then simply return false.
      Parameters:
      p_gameMap - Game map object
      Returns:
      true if the map is valid otherwise false

    • showMap

      public void showMap(WargameMap p_map)
      This method has the logic to display the passed map into text format to the user
      Parameters:
      p_map - map object to be displayed

    • saveMap

      public boolean saveMap(WargameMap p_map, String p_fileName)
      This function is used to write continent, country and neighbours/borders to a map file It is executed when user enters savemap command It first displays continents then countries and then borders
      Parameters:
      p_map - map object whose value needs to be saved
      p_fileName - filename where map's values are saved
      Returns:
      true if map save is successful otherwise false

    • loadMap

      public WargameMap loadMap(String p_map)
      Load map for playing the game. It checks whether map file exist or not.
      Parameters:
      p_map - name of the map to be used for playing the game.
      Returns:
      l_gameMap represents the existing map to be used for playing the game.

    • validateMap

      public boolean validateMap(WargameMap p_map)
      It consist of various validity checks to ensure that map is suitable for playing the game. Checks: 1) any empty continent is present or not, i.e. continent without any country 2) map for the game is connected graph or not 3) each continent in map is a connected sub-graph or not
      Parameters:
      p_map - GameMap to be checked.
      Returns:
      return true if map is valid, else false indicate invalid map

    • editMapUtil

      public WargameMap editMapUtil(String p_mapName)

    • validateMapUtil

      public boolean validateMapUtil(WargameMap p_map)
